state.output:
<file>
00001| # <a name="up"/>Vozovoz API 2.5
00002| 
00003| [Main page](/en/README.md) > [Request data structures](index.md) > Cargo
00004| 
00005| ## Contents
00006| 
00007| * [Data structure](#struct)
00008|     * [`cargo` structure](#cargo)
00009|         * [`dimension` structure](#dimension)
00010|             * [`max` structure (Maximal dimensions of a collo)](#max)
00011|         * [`wizard` structure (Set cargo by describing every collo)](#wizard)
00012|         * [`wrapping` structure](#wrapping)
00013| * [Examples](#example)
00014| 
00015| 
00016| ## <a name="struct"/>Data structure
00017| 
00018| >In this manual for easier understanding a word **_structures_** will be used
00019| to name any structured data (mostly that contains other structures inside,
00020| but also that contains simple data types, like string, number, boolean).
00021| We name **full** necessary data object, that used in a request to our server
00022| — ["parameters"](../params/index.md). Key to pass "parameters" into a request
00023| called "params". More about that [here](../params/post.md). And we name **_nodes_**
00024| certain structures with a defined key, that this structure is assigned to.
00025| 
00026| 
00027| ### <a name="cargo"/>`cargo` structure
00028| 
00029| | Name                      | Type    | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
00030| |---------------------------|---------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00031| | `category`                | string  | Contains unique identificator of this cargo's category. _Optional node (used only for actions with an order)_                                                                                                |
00032| | `correspondence`          | boolean | Does this cargo contains correspondence, a safe package with any documents. _Optional node (`false` by default)_                                                                                             |
00033| | [`dimension`](#dimension) | object  | Contains data about this cargo's dimensions. Can be omitted, if `"correspondence": true`                                                                                                                     |
00034| | `insurance`               | integer | Sets declared value of the cargo insurance (in Russian rubles only) _Optional node_                                                                                                                          |
00035| | `insuranceNdv`            | boolean | Sets the state of an insurance of non-declared value type. Turns off automatically, if you use a declared value insurance (can be omitted), otherwise forcibly turns on if a payer of the order is a company |
00036| | [`wizard`](#wizard)       | object  | Contains dimension descriptions collo-by-collo (replaces `dimension` node). _Optional node_                                                                                                                  |
00037| | [`wrapping`](#wrapping)   | object  | Contains wrapping data structure (both general volumetric and quantity-related ones). _Optional node_                                                                                                        |
00038| 
00039| Example
00040| 
00041| ```javascript
00042| {
00043|   "category": "12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab",
00044|   "correspondence": true,
00045|   "dimension": { /* for more information see "Dimension" structure */ },
00046|   "insurance": 6500,
00047|   "wrapping": { /* for more information see "Wrapping" structure */ }
00048| }
00049| ```
00050| 
00051| 
00052| ### <a name="dimension"/>`dimension` structure
00053| 
00054| >Every dimension is being accepted the same as on the website: volume in cubic meters, weight in kilograms.
00055| 
00056| | Name           | Type    | Description                                                                                                                            |
00057| |----------------|---------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00058| | [`max`](#max)  | object  | Structure that defines maximal dimensions of a collo. Required in case cargo is over size (OOG) or general dimensions has not been set |
00059| | `quantity`     | integer | Positive integer that defines **quantity of colli**. _Optional. Default is **1** (piece)_                                              |
00060| | `volume`       | float   | Positive fractional number that defines **general volume** of a cargo. _Optional, if maximal dimensions has been set (m<sup>3</sup>)_  |
00061| | `weight`       | float   | Positive fractional number that deinfes **general weight** of a cargo. _Optional, if maximal dimensions has been set (kg)_             |
00062| 
00063| Example
00064| 
00065| ```javascript
00066| {
00067|   "max": {
00068|     "height": 0.2,
00069|     "length": 0.4,
00070|     "weight": 12.4,
00071|     "width": 0.1
00072|   },
00073|   "quantity": 2,
00074|   "volume": 0.01,
00075|   "weight": 24.8 // general weight cannot be less than maximal weight of a collo
00076| }
00077| ```
00078| 
00079| ### <a name="max"/>`max` structure (Maximal dimensions of a collo)
00080| 
00081| | Name     | Type  | Description                                                                |
00082| |----------|-------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00083| | `height` | float | Maximal height of a collo from all the colli in the order _(in meters)_    |
00084| | `length` | float | Maximal length of a collo from all the colli in the order _(in meters)_    |
00085| | `weight` | float | Maximal weight of a collo from all the colli in the order _(in kilograms)_ |
00086| | `width`  | float | Maximal width of a collo from all the colli in the order _(in meters)_     |
00087| 
00088| Example
00089| 
00090| ```json
00091| {
00092|   "height": 0.2,
00093|   "length": 0.4,
00094|   "weight": 12.4,
00095|   "width": 0.1
00096| }
00097| ```
00098| 
00099| ### <a name="wizard"/>`wizard` structure (Set cargo by describing every collo)
00100| 
00101| Example
00102| 
00103| ```javascript
00104| {
00105|   "wizard": [
00106|     { // collo 1
00107|       "length": 0.3,
00108|       "width": 0.2,
00109|       "height": 0.1,
00110|       "quantity": 2, // this means it's 2 colli with these dimensions (length, width, height, weight)
00111|       "weight": 10,
00112|       "wrapping": {  // volumetric wrapping only
00113|           "bubbleFilmVolume": 0.5
00114|       }
00115|     },
00116|     { // collo 2
00117|       "length": 0.5,
00118|       "width": 0.1,
00119|       "height": 0.5,
00120|       "quantity": 3, // this means it's 3 colli with these dimensions (length, width, height, weight)
00121|       "weight": 8,
00122|       "wrapping": {} // volumetric wrapping only
00123|     }
00124|   ]
00125| }
00126| ```
00127| 
00128| ### <a name="wrapping"/>`Wrapping` structure
00129| 
00130| > More about wrappings' codes in ["Wrapping" object](../object/wrapping.md).
00131| 
00132| Example
00133| 
00134| ```javascript
00135| "wrapping": {
00136|   box1: 2, // 2 pcs. of the box with code `box1`
00137|   bubbleFilmVolume: 0.5, // 0.5m^3 - volume of a bubble film, that will be used as a wrapping
00138| }
00139| ```
00140| 
00141| ## <a name="example"/>Examples
00142| 
00143| ```javascript
00144| // full javascript code to use in web browser developer console, see in "Quick start" section
00145| xhttp.send(JSON.stringify(
00146| {
00147|   "object": "price",
00148|   "action": "get",
00149|   "params": {
00150|     "cargo" : {
00151|       "dimension": {
00152|         "max": {
00153|           "length": 0.1, // maximal length of a collo
00154|           "height": 0.1, // maximal height of a collo
00155|           "weight": 0.9, // maximal weight of a collo
00156|           "width": 0.1 // maximal width of a collo
00157|         },
00158|         "quantity": 1, // quantity of colli
00159|         "volume": 0.01, // general volume
00160|         "weight": 0.9 // general weight
00161|       }
00162|     },
00163|     "gateway": {
00164|       "dispatch": { // where from
00165|         "point": {
00166|           "location": "Санкт-Петербург",
00167|           "terminal": "default" // terminal by default
00168|         }
00169|       },
00170|       "destination": { // where to
00171|         "point": {
00172|           "location": "Москва",
00173|           "terminal": "default" // terminal by default
00174|         }
00175|       }
00176|     }
00177|   }
00178| }));
00179| ```
00180| 
00181| ```javascript
00182| xhttp.send(JSON.stringify(
00183| {
00184|   "object": "price",
00185|   "action": "get",
00186|   "params": {
00187|     "cargo" : {
00188|       "wizard": [ // exact info for each colli
00189|         { // collo 1
00190|           "length": 0.3, // length of the collo
00191|           "width": 0.2, // width of the collo
00192|           "height": 0.1, // height of the collo
00193|           "quantity": 2, // quantity of the colli with the same dimensions,
00194|           // in other words, if dimensions are the same, you just write here quantity of such colli
00195|           "weight": 10, // weight of the collo
00196|           "wrapping": { // here used only volumetric wrapping
00197|             "bubbleFilmVolume": 0.5
00198|           }
00199|         },
00200|         { // collo 2 (other dimensions)
00201|           "length": 0.5,
00202|           "width": 0.1,
00203|           "height": 0.5,
00204|           "quantity": 3,
00205|           "weight": 8,
00206|           "wrapping": {} // here used only volumetric wrapping
00207|         }
00208|       ]
00209|     },
00210|     "gateway": {
00211|       "dispatch": { // where from
00212|         "point": {
00213|           "location": "Санкт-Петербург",
00214|           "terminal": "default" // a terminal by default
00215|         }
00216|       },
00217|       "destination": { // where to
00218|         "point": {
00219|           "location": "Москва",
00220|           "terminal": "default" // a terminal by default
00221|         }
00222|       }
00223|     }
00224|   }
00225| }));
00226| ```
00227| 
00228| ***
00229| [▲ Up](#up)

(End of file - total 229 lines)
</file>

# <a name="up"/>Vozovoz API 2.5

[Main page](/en/README.md) > [Request data structures](index.md) > Cargo

## Contents

* [Data structure](#struct)
    * [`cargo` structure](#cargo)
        * [`dimension` structure](#dimension)
            * [`max` structure (Maximal dimensions of a collo)](#max)
        * [`wizard` structure (Set cargo by describing every collo)](#wizard)
        * [`wrapping` structure](#wrapping)
* [Examples](#example)


## <a name="struct"/>Data structure

>In this manual for easier understanding a word **_structures_** will be used
to name any structured data (mostly that contains other structures inside,
but also that contains simple data types, like string, number, boolean).
